# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a Julia function called `wrap_string` that takes in a string and a maximum text width, iterates over words, and adds a new line each time the maximum width would be exceeded:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(text)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = string(word, "\n")
        else
            current_line *= string(word, " ")
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "")
end
```

And here's an example usage of the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium."
print(wrap_string(text))
```

This will output:

```
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium.
```
